meanings.definition: A person or thing that furls.
meanings.sent1: The furlers on the ship were busy folding the sails.
meanings.sent2: The furlers neatly rolled up the flag after the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be a furler, wrapping her blanket around her like a sail.
meanings.sent4: The furlers of the flag danced in the wind, creating a mesmerizing display.
meanings.sent5: The furlers carefully twisted the rope around the pole, securing the banner in place.

meanings.definition: A device used for furling sails.
meanings.sent1: The sailors relied on the furlers to neatly pack away the sails.
meanings.sent2: The new furlers made it easier to roll up the sails quickly.
meanings.sent3: The furlers looked like giant spindles, spinning the sails into a tight bundle.
meanings.sent4: The furlers hummed softly as they wound the sail around the mast.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the furlers ensured the sails were stored efficiently.

meanings.sent1: The furlers of the flag were done with precision and care.
meanings.sent2: The furlers of the umbrella were simple to use, just twist and fold.
meanings.sent3: The furlers of the party decorations worked tirelessly to roll up the streamers.
meanings.sent4: The furlers of the scroll gently wrapped the ancient document for safekeeping.
meanings.sent5: The furlers of the map carefully folded the corners to reveal the hidden treasure.
